A: 1. Technology includes inventions like tools, machines, and _? (a) feelings (b) materials (c) colors)
2. Technology makes work and lives _ for people? (a) harder (b) easier (c) longer)
3. Computers and mobiles are _ technology? (a) the only (b) not the only (c) new)
4. Technology is when people use knowledge to create something to solve _ problems? (a) old (b) existing (c) future)
5. Technology helps produce fire using matches instead of _? (a) water (b) stones (c) wood)
6. Technology is the application of _ for practical purposes? (a) art (b) history (c) science)
7. Using a gas cooker for cooking is an example of the importance of _? (a) nature (b) technology (c) art)
8. Washing clothes with a machine shows technology's importance in _? (a) playing (b) washing (c) eating)
9. Using a refrigerator to keep food is a way of _ food? (a) heating (b) preserving (c) cooking)
10. Watching movies on TV is an example of technology used for _? (a) work (b) relaxation (c) learning)
11. Moving from one place to another by bus is a product of technology in _? (a) communication (b) transportation (c) banking)
12. Speaking using a mobile phone is a product of technology in _? (a) farming (b) communication (c) home)
13. Traffic officers at work are part of _ control technology? (a) noise (b) traffic (c) air)
14. ATM machines are products of technology used in _? (a) business (b) banking (c) farming)
15. A harvester is a product of technology used in _? (a) home (b) farming (c) business)
16. A TV is a product of technology used in the _? (a) office (b) school (c) home)
17. A photocopy machine is a product of technology used in _? (a) business (b) cooking (c) washing)
18. ICT stands for Information and _ Technology? (a) Cooking (b) Communication (c) Computer)
19. ICT gadgets transmit and _ information? (a) destroy (b) receive (c) hide)
20. A mobile phone is an example of an ICT _? (a) building (b) gadget (c) food)
21. ICT gadgets operate by using _? (a) water (b) energy (c) sand)
22. ICT gadgets usually get energy from mains sockets or _? (a) sun (b) wind (c) batteries)
23. ICT gadgets make our life _? (a) harder (b) easier (c) slower)
24. ICT gadgets increase _? (a) sadness (b) productivity (c) hunger)
25. ICT gadgets allow people to work at home and _? (a) never (b) anywhere (c) only in office)
26. ICT gadgets help bring people _? (a) apart (b) together (c) far)
27. ICT gadgets make teaching and learning more _? (a) difficult (b) complicated (c) easier)
28. ICT gadgets are used for _? (a) sadness (b) entertainment (c) crying)
29. A flat shape like a rectangle is _-dimensional? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
30. Shape construction is the making of _-dimensional shapes? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
31. A cylinder is an example of a _-dimensional shape? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
32. One method used in shape construction is _? (a) painting (b) folding (c) drawing)
33. Paper, metal, and _ are materials used for shape construction? (a) plastic (b) wood (c) glass)
34. A funnel can be constructed using _? (a) wood (b) metal (c) paper)
35. A knife can be constructed using _? (a) paper (b) wood (c) metal)
36. A building is a structure with walls and a _? (a) garden (b) roof (c) fence)
37. A house provides protection from the local _? (a) animals (b) environment (c) people)
38. A bungalow is a type of _? (a) car (b) building (c) tree)
39. A school building is an example of an _ building? (a) residential (b) educational (c) business)
40. A church is a type of _ center? (a) business (b) worship (c) hospital)
B: 1. What is the application of science for practical purposes called?_________
2. What is one basic need of life that a building provides?_________
3. What is the ability to do work or get work done?_________
4. What changes one form of energy into another more useful form?_________
5. What are the initials for Information and Communication Technology?_________
answers_C: Technology provides tools and machines that simplify tasks, and it helps create new things to solve existing problems.
Microphone, transistor radio, land telephone, mobile phones.
Educational, Residential, Assembly, Factory, Worship, Business, Hospital.
Mechanical energy, Chemical energy, Electrical energy, Heat energy, Light energy, Solar energy, Sound energy.
